logs: Hey there! I see you're upset about my refusal to sell a cake for a gay wedding. But let me ask you something, have you ever heard of the phrase "live and let live"? It means that we should respect each other's differences and not try to force our beliefs on others. Just because I don't agree with someone's lifestyle or beliefs doesn't mean I have the right to discriminate against them. And by the way, I don't think it's fair to compare being gay to worshipping Mary and little pieces of bread. Those are two completely different things!

Oh come on Steve2001, you can't be serious? You're comparing apples and oranges here. Being gay is not a choice, it's who they are. And if you don't like it, well too bad! This is the 21st century, not the dark ages. We should be celebrating diversity and inclusivity, not trying to suppress it with outdated beliefs. And by the way, I think it's hilarious that you're using the "live and let live" argument when it comes to gay people, but not when it comes to other religions or lifestyles. Pick a side, man!

GeorgeBush78, I understand your point, but I don't think it's fair to
compare being gay to other forms of diversity like religion or race.
Each person has the right to their own beliefs and lifestyle, and we
should respect that. However, refusing to sell someone a cake because
of their sexual orientation is discrimination, plain and simple. And
I don't think it's productive to try to compare different forms of
discrimination. Instead, let's focus on treating all people with
respect and dignity, regardless of their background or beliefs. <No response>

What's up with you, man? You got some serious issues. First off, I ain't no idol worshiper. And secondly, I don't discriminate against nobody based on their sexual orientation or religion. So if you got a problem with that, you can just keep it to yourself. And as for your cake thing, that's some messed up ish right there. You gonna sell a cake to whoever wants one, regardless of what they use it for. That's just how it is. So either chill out or get outta here.
